communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2023-ICFO-20828
communications.communication:
04/17/2023Andrew FreeMuckRock News, DEPT MR144290Boston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-20828        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your 4/6/2023, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all records created by ICE in response to the FOIA request assigned individualized tracking number 2023-ICFO-15203. Please specifically task a search for C. Martinez and Joshua Farnkopf, Esq., as well as any FOIA talkers and responses sent or received by ICE FOIA between February 23, 2023, and April 5, 2023. Your request was received in this office on 4/6/2023.Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you’re able to narrow the scope of your request please contact our office. Narrowing the scope may speed up the search process. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued.We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Fernando Pineiro Jr. at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-20828. Please use this number in future correspondence. Sincerely,ICE FOIA OfficeImmigration and Customs EnforcementFreedom of Information Act Office500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014122-082823 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 

Please note that District Offices will be closed on Monday, September 4th in observance of Labor Day.

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

*Sandra Moy, current CPS teacher 
*Scott Koenaman, security officer, Budlong Elementary 
*Danielle Rutkowski, current CPS teacher 
*Alesia Maria Franklin-Allen, current CPS Principal 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252F2023-personnel-files-school-based-staff-151293%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ1CCn_QB9jem9PQylx6L91s%3A1qanxm%3Am46Tdf0iF0_MhizGB5lJza1_XmwVun2H1Sp2O7r_pSU 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Certain records are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f) as factual information inextricably intertwined in ongoing investigation and processes as well as 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(n), which exempts from release records relating to the adjudication of employee discipline and grievance matters except for records reflecting the final outcome. Section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: 
Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, 
Patricia Majchrowicz FOIA Officer Chicago Public Schools

Alejandro Ruizesparza 
Dear Alejandro: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014101-082423 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

- Vanessa Puentes, former principal at John Hancock College Preparatory High School (JHCPHS) 
- Froylan Jimenez, current CPS teacher and JHCPHS LSC member 
- Abla Ayesh, current CPS teacher and JHCPHS LSC member 
- Alexander Roman Martinez, current CPS security and JHCPHS LSC member 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Alejandro Ruizesparza 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fjohn-hancock-college-preparatory-high-school-personnel-files-151199%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ1CCn_QB9jem9PQylx6L91s%3A1qZMog%3Ax2bvkJZqpBtTLelLeeQXyfq9mxiz4De0W-DGBrE2PrQ 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. 
Please also note that certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. 
Section 7(1)(n) of the FOIA exempts from release “Records relating to a public body's adjudication of employee grievances or disciplinary cases. Records of discipline more than four years old are exempt from disclosure pursuant to section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)), which exempts information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.]. 820 ILCS 40/8 of the Personnel Records Review Act states that “an employer shall review a personnel record before releasing information to a third party and, except when the release is ordered to a party in a legal action or arbitration, delete disciplinary reports, letters of reprimand, or other records of disciplinary action which are more than 4 years old.” 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: 
Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, 
Patricia Majchrowicz FOIA Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: V-safe logs and modifications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Server logs related to the V-safe program from January 1, 2023, to August 30, 2023.
2. Documentation detailing any software modifications, updates, or changes made to the V-safe program that led to its discontinuation of collecting new adverse event reports related to COVID-19 vaccines.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #23-01724-FOIA
communications.communication:
Dear Roger Andoh,

I am writing to follow up on my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated August 30, 2023, concerning the V-safe program. My request was assigned the number 23-01724-FOIA and placed in your complex processing queue.

I hereby request expedited processing of my FOIA request in accordance with the U.S. Department of Justice's guidelines for the following reasons:

Imminent Threat to Life or Physical Safety: The V-safe program is directly related to the monitoring of adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination. Given the ongoing pandemic and the critical nature of vaccine safety, timely access to this information could be life-saving for individuals considering vaccination.

Urgency to Inform the Public: The V-safe program involves actual federal government activity that is of urgent concern to the public. The sooner this information is released, the sooner the public can make informed decisions about their health.

Widespread and Exceptional Media Interest: The COVID-19 pandemic and vaccination efforts are subjects of exceptional media interest. The integrity of the V-safe program and how it has been managed could significantly affect public confidence in the government's handling of the pandemic.

Given these compelling reasons, I also request a rolling release of records as they become available. This would serve the public interest by providing critical information as quickly as possible.

Hi Mr. Tobias,

Thank you for your email requesting status of your FOIA request DOC-IOS-2018-00593. We have received all of the office unit responses and the documents are being reviewed for disclosure. As soon as, this disclosure determinations have been made, we will send to you a response to your FOIA request.

We are, however, experiencing a significant increase in FOIA requests which has resulted in a backlog in responses.

We continue to work diligently to get your FOIA processed as quickly as we can. If you have any questions, I can be reached at 202-482-3257 or at BParsons@doc.gov<mailto:BParsons@doc.gov>

Bobbie

On Jan. 17, 2018:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

Any and all available calendars, daily itineraries, and schedules of activities for Assistant Secretary Michael Platt, Jr. since he took office in August 2017.

I am a reporter for The Nation magazine, and the requested documents will be made available to the general public. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 47708-06573024@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:47708-06573024@requests.muckrock.com>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOC-OS-2018-000591
communications.communication:
Hi,

We are still in the midst of reviewing documents for disclosure.  We are experiencing a backlog in responding to FOIA request due to lack of employees working in FOIA and the volume of FOIA requests our Department has received.  As soon as the review process can be completed, we will send to you, a final response.

Thanks,
Bobbie


Bobbie Parsons
Acting Deputy Chief FOIA Officer and
   Acting Deputy Program Director for FOIA/Privacy Act Operations

communications.communication:
DOC-IOS-2018-000591 has been processed with the following final disposition: Partial Grant/Partial Denial. 
Records were released to the public as a result of this request. communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOC-OS-2018-000591
communications.communication:
Thank you Bobbie. I appreciate it.

Is there a way to get a more detailed calendar for AS Platt. The calendar provided is mostly unreadable or the entries are cut off. Please let me now. I'd be happy to hop on the phone if that is easier.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOC-OS-2018-000591
communications.communication:
Hi Mr. Tobias,

Unfortunately, what I sent to you is what I received from Mr. Platt's office.  If you would like, you can appeal your FOIA response by following the instructions in your determination letter.

Thanks,
Bobbie

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Flock
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all invoices submitted by Flock Safety or containing the keyword "Flock" between the dates of January 1, 2017 and May 26, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Flock

title: Use of Force Policy (Biloxi Police Department)

communications.communication:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

On March 24, 2023, the State of New Jersey Office of the Attorney General issued a press release stating: "AG Platkin Announces 20 NJ Law Enforcement Agencies to Receive Grants Totaling $7 Million for Technology to Combat Gun Violence." The City of Atlanta City is listed as a recipient of a $333,700 grant. (https://www.njoag.gov/ag-platkin-announces-20-nj-law-enforcement-agencies-to-receive-grants-totaling-7-million-for-technology-to-combat-gun-violence/)

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the City of Atlantic City's $333,700 grant awarded by the Office of Attorney General, Department of Law and Public Safety and described in the press release linked above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CoS Rich Giudice Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the calendar entries for Chief of Staff Rich Giudice for the months of August 2023 and September 2023 to date. Please include entries from any/all calendars associated with Rich Giudice, not limited to his primary email account.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser

communications.subject: [Records Center] Office of the Mayor :: F056949-091923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 September 27, 2023 Anthony Moser Via email at 152189-45772770@requests.muckrock.com RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of September 19, 2023, Reference # F056949-091923. Dear Anthony Moser, On behalf of the Office of the Mayor, I am responding to your Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") request which was dated September 19, 2023 and received in our office on the same day. At this time, the Office of the Mayor is seeking an extension of five additional working days to respond to the requests for one or more of the following reasons identified in 5 ILCS 140/3(e) of FOIA: (xx) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; (  ) the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; (  ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; (  ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; (xx) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of the FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; (  ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3(d) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; (xx) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. Sincerely, Thomas Skelton 
FOIA Officer 
Mayor's Office

--- Please respond above this line --- 

 September 28, 2023 Anthony Moser Via email at 152189-45772770@requests.muckrock.com RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of September 19, 2023, Reference # F056949-091923. Dear Anthony Moser, This correspondence is in response to the Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") request received by the City of Chicago Office of the Mayor on September 19, 2023. The Office of the Mayor took a 5 business day extension to your request on September 27, 2023. You requested: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Records sufficient to show the calendar entries for Chief of Staff Rich Giudice for the months of August 2023 and September 2023 to date. Please include entries from any/all calendars associated with Rich Giudice, not limited to his primary email account. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Anthony Moser 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmayors-office-885%252Fcos-rich-giudice-calendar-152189%252F%253Femail%253DMOfoia%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAVakss4kqDBu4naYY4htHES6U%3A1qioKt%3AOK5f73qJG_CutvwFczgLwvfrDgzyUZJON--8vvAI3UY" 
Please find the attached records responsive to your request. We have redacted certain material pursuant to Section 7(1)(b) of FOIA.  That section exempts “private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order.”  5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b).  Section 2(c-5) defines “private information" as: 

unique identifiers, including a person's social security number, driver's license number, employee identification number, biometric identifiers, personal financial information, passwords or other access codes, medical records, home or personal telephone numbers, and personal email addresses. Private information also includes home address and personal license plates, except as otherwise provided by law or when compiled without possibility of attribution to any person. 

5 ILCS 140/2(c-5).  The material we have redacted under this section is access codes.  Because these items are specifically exempted under Section 7(1)(b), they have been properly redacted. 
We have redacted certain material pursuant to Section 7(1)(c) of FOIA.  That section exempts: 

[p]ersonal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information.  ‘Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy’ means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in in which the subject’s right of privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information.  The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. 

We have redacted the identity of job applicants under Section 7(1)(c) of FOIA.  Individuals who go through an application process or examination process to attain a certain job or position have an expectation that this information would not be publicly disseminated if they are unsuccessful in attaining the position.  In 2011 PAC 13060, the PAC cited to an earlier decision to explain why release of all information relating to all unsuccessful applicants is exempt.  The PAC stated, “…the fact that an individual is seeking new employment for a position is information that a reasonable person would view as highly personal and the release of that information is likely to be viewed as objectionable by most individuals.  Publication of an individual’s application for a position can negatively impact that individual’s current employment….”  Also, in 2010 PAC 6243, the PAC held that the names of applicants who completed the Firefighter/EMT exam are exempt pursuant to Section 7(1)(c).  Thus, the Mayor's Office has properly redacted the identity of job applicants under Section 7(1)(c) of FOIA. You have the right to have a denial reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, (877) 299-3642. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 312-744-3844. Sincerely, Thomas Skelton 
FOIA Officer 
Mayor's Office

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Paula Sladewski Case (Miami Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records/photos/videos/audio and other materials related to the disappearance and death investigation of Paula Sladewski. (Reported missing and body identified on January 3, 2010)

Including, but not limited to:
- Reports from Medical Examiner 
- Surveillance footage from approx 7am-8am from Space Club showing Kevin Klym and then Paula Sladewski leaving with an unknown male
- Incident reports from discovery of body
- Police reports about attempt to file missing person report
- Correspondence about FDLE taking over the case
- Other investigative reports

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Rob Vernier

communications.subject: MR#34570-345685 - Freedom of Information Request: Aldo Moro
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Aldo Romeo Luigi Moro (23 September 1916 – 9 May 1978) was an Italian statesman and politician, and a prominent member of the Christian Democracy party. He served as 38th Prime Minister of Italy, from 1963 to 1968, and then from 1974 to 1976. He was one of Italy's longest-serving post-war Prime Ministers, holding power for a combined total of more than seven years.

Proof of death is not required as his death has been widely reported on:

http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/aldo-moro-found-dead
https://www.theguardian.com/theguardian/2013/may/08/aldo-moro-red-brigades-1978
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1581425/US-envoy-admits-role-in-Aldo-Moro-killing.html

In addition please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Joseph Lloyd
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.

communications.subject: Follow-up on FOIA Request NLRB-2023-001998 (NxGen participant info)
communications.communication:
CAUTION: This email and any attachments may contain Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) regulations at 32 CFR Part 2002 apply to all executive branch agencies that designate or handle information that meets the standards for CUI.

I'm working on FOIA request NLRB-2023-001998 for "all non-exempt fields of the participant and participant_party tables from the NxGen case management system database."

NxGen designates participants to have one of four roles:

  *   Primary: This is usually the main address of the facility as designated on the charge or petition
  *   Legal Rep: Legal representation for the primary participant
  *   Additional Service: These are people who would be like a cc in letters,  or it could be a secondary address for someone.  For example: many union reps list their official business address as primary, and because they might be located in a remote area or working from home, they have a secondary address or home address listed as an additional service.
  *   Notification: This are the national or international union headquarters.  To become a notification, the organization has to file Form 4702 annually, and the notification party only receives a copy of the charge or petition.

Participants also have distinct roles: Employer, Union, Individual, and Union as an Employer.

NxGen further designates participants as: Charging Party, Charged Party/Respondent, Involved Party, Petitioner, Intervenor, Employer, and Amicus.

Instead of providing a dump of all the participants in the system, and in order to provide the most relevant case information, my recommendation for participants is to provide the Primary participant information (entity name and address) and exclude the Legal Reps, Additional Services, and Notifications.  Also, because the participant tables do not contain any other case-specific information besides the case number, I would recommend including the case name, date filed, date closed, and case closing reason.  I also recommend information for individual charging parties/petitioners be listed simply as the party type of "Individual" and to exclude individuals' personal address  information from your request (we would withheld it per Exemptions 6 and 7(C) if it's not specifically excluded.)  Further, I would also recommend excluding Amicus information since cases can only have Amicus filings if the Board approves it.

communications.subject: RE: Follow-up on FOIA Request NLRB-2023-001998 (NxGen participant info)
communications.communication:
CAUTION: This email and any attachments may contain Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) regulations at 32 CFR Part 2002 apply to all executive branch agencies that designate or handle information that meets the standards for CUI.

Just wanted to let you know that the records for this request will be released to you within the hour.  One of the files we’re releasing is too big to be attached to an email, so in addition to making the records available directly in FOIAonline, we’re also going to upload them to a secure NLRB site.  You’ll receive a separate secure email with instructions to access the records on that site.

Just a reminder that FOIAonline is being decommissioned on Saturday, September 30, so any records in that system will no longer be available after that date.  Also, if there is a government shutdown, the secure NLRB file site will be unavailable until funding is restored.

Let me know if you have any questions. ☺

communications.subject: Final Disposition, Request NLRB-2023-001998
communications.communication:
Earlier today, the Agency’s letter and responsive records were provided to you in an encrypted/secure email. A copy of the letter is attached to this email; however, the records are not attached here because they exceed the attachment file size allowed by FOIAonline. Please follow the instructions in the secure email and download the records before 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time on Friday, October 27, 2023.  In the event of a government shutdown, the secure site will be unavailable until funding is restored. 

If you have questions about accessing the secure email and records, please contact FOIA Specialist Jodilyn Breirather at (414) 930-7208 or by email at Jodilyn.Breirather@nlrb.gov. 

PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS EMAIL; THIS IS NOT A MONITORED EMAIL ACCOUNT.

title: Martinsville West MS Shooting Incident report

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Martinsville West MS Shooting Incident report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Martinsville West Middle School on March 25, 2000.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Baker

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AntiSec 2012 breach
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning or generated as a result of the breach allegedly by AntiSec of the Lake County Sheriff's Office in in 2012.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Owen Brewster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into Ralph Owen Brewster (February 22, 1888 – December 25, 1961), who represented Maine in the Senate from January 1941 to December 1952. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1580730-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.
